Module org.microbean.loader.typesafe.config
Package org.microbean.loader.typesafe.config

Class TypesafeConfigHoconProvider

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractProvider
org.microbean.loader.spi.AbstractTreeBasedProvider<ConfigValue>
org.microbean.loader.typesafe.config.TypesafeConfigHoconProvider
All Implemented Interfaces:
Provider
public class TypesafeConfigHoconProvider extends AbstractTreeBasedProvider<ConfigValue>
An AbstractTreeBasedProvider that uses a Config to produce Values.
Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
  • AbstractProvider.get(Loader, Path)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TypesafeConfigHoconProvider()
    Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource named application.conf, using the context classloader.

    Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource bearing the supplied name using the supplied ClassLoader.
    TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(Type lowerBound, ClassLoader cl, String resourceName)
    Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource bearing the supplied name using the supplied ClassLoader.
    TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(String resourceName)
    Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource bearing the supplied name using the context classloader.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    protected final boolean
    absent(ConfigValue node)
    Returns true if the supplied node is null, absent or synthetic.
    protected final ConfigValue
    get(ConfigValue node, int index)
    Returns the child node of the supplied parent node identified by the supplied index, or null if either the child does not exist or node is not a list node.
    protected final ConfigValue
    get(ConfigValue node, String name)
    Returns the child node of the supplied parent node identified by the supplied name, or null if either the child does not exist or node is not a map node.
    protected final boolean
    list(ConfigValue node)
    Returns true if the supplied node represents a list or an array, and therefore the AbstractTreeBasedProvider.get(Object, int) method is likely to be relevant.
    protected final boolean
    map(ConfigValue node)
    Returns true if the supplied node represents a map, and therefore the AbstractTreeBasedProvider.get(Object, String) method is likely to be relevant.
    protected final Iterator<String>
    names(ConfigValue node)
    Returns an Iterator over the names of the supplied node's child nodes, or an empty Iterator if the supplied node is not a map node.
    protected final boolean
    nil(ConfigValue node)
    Returns true if the supplied node is null or represents an explicitly set null value.
    protected final ConfigValue
    qualifiers(ConfigValue node)
    Returns a node possibly containing qualifiers applicable to the supplied node, or null.
    protected BiFunction<? super ConfigValue,? super Type,?>
    reader(Loader<?> requestor, Path<? extends Type> absolutePath)
    Returns a BiFunction accepting a node and a Type and returning the result of reading an object of that type, or null if no such BiFunction could be sourced.
    protected ConfigValue
    rootNode(Loader<?> requestor, Path<? extends Type> absolutePath)
    Returns the root node of the tree that is suitable for the supplied Loader and Path, or null if no tree is suitable.
    protected final int
    size(ConfigValue node)
    Returns the number of child nodes the supplied node has, which may be (and often is) 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • TypesafeConfigHoconProvider

      public TypesafeConfigHoconProvider()
      Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource named application.conf, using the context classloader.

      No stacking of other configurations is performed.

      See Also:
      • TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(ClassLoader, String)

    • TypesafeConfigHoconProvider

      public TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(String resourceName)
      Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource bearing the supplied name using the context classloader.

      No stacking of other configurations is performed.

      Parameters:
      resourceName - the name of the classpath resource; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if resourceName is null
      See Also:
      • TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(ClassLoader, String)

    • TypesafeConfigHoconProvider

      public TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(ClassLoader cl, String resourceName)
      Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource bearing the supplied name using the supplied ClassLoader.

      No stacking of other configurations is performed.

      Parameters:
      cl - the ClassLoader; may be null in which case the system classloader will be used instead, normally via ClassLoader.getSystemResourceAsStream(String)
      resourceName - the name of the classpath resource; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if resourceName is null

    • TypesafeConfigHoconProvider

      public TypesafeConfigHoconProvider(Type lowerBound, ClassLoader cl, String resourceName)
      Creates a new TypesafeConfigHoconProvider that reads solely from a classpath resource bearing the supplied name using the supplied ClassLoader.

      No stacking of other configurations is performed.

      Parameters:
      lowerBound - the lower type bound of this TypesafeConfigHoconProvider implementation; may be null
      cl - the ClassLoader; may be null in which case the system classloader will be used instead, normally via ClassLoader.getSystemResourceAsStream(String)
      resourceName - the name of the classpath resource; must not be null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if resourceName is null

    • size

      protected final int size(ConfigValue node)
      Description copied from class: AbstractTreeBasedProvider
      Returns the number of child nodes the supplied node has, which may be (and often is) 0.

      If the supplied null is null, absent or a scalar, an override of this method must return 0.

      Specified by:
      size in class AbstractTreeBasedProvider<ConfigValue>
      Parameters:
      node - the parent node; may be null in which case 0 must be returned
      Returns:
      the number of child nodes the supplied node has, which may be (and often is) 0

      Description copied from class: AbstractTreeBasedProvider
      Returns a BiFunction accepting a node and a Type and returning the result of reading an object of that type, or null if no such BiFunction could be sourced.
      Specified by:
      reader in class AbstractTreeBasedProvider<ConfigValue>
      Parameters:
      requestor - the Loader currently executing a request; must not be null
      absolutePath - the path being requested; must not be null and must be absolute
      Returns:
      a BiFunction accepting a node and a Type and returning the result of reading an object of that type, or null if no such BiFunction could be sourced
